annotation.TEXT: Yep, and I still have my key! But, argh... I didn't expect a hidden coin block there. So, I'll need to go get the P-switch again.
As expected, the key is removed. Oh, but there's a problem... How are you meant to get a blue P-switch here, since you needed to hit it in the previous room to enter here?
Trick shot on the falling snake.
And, here's a shell-in-a-box, and for some reason, it makes my key invisible unless I'm turning around. I bet the shell was meant to be used on the key block.
BGM: Undertale - Megalovania
Oh, it's a P-switch door.
Alright, I'm gonna get back to the usual revisiting of levels to look for changes now. But, since I spent so long in Walkla Town, I think I'll only play one more level today.
Uh, oh. I hope I don't ascend straight into a Phanto here...
I wonder if that's a reset pipe. I might come back to it in a moment.
Mark D, I'd suggest lowering the height of that wall springboard by 1 tile, which should fix the issue, I think. Anyway, that's a lot of Phantos...
...D'oh! I need to bring the springboard here as well!
Heh, my fireballs' silhouettes were barely visible in the letters there. Anyway, that's all for this episode! Next time, I'll see if I can finish up revisiting world 2!
Ludicrous speed time! (UPDATE: It's been pointed out that there was a blue P-switch in that key room, which I just didn't see at first. I'll point it out next time.)
And, I'm suddenly back on the OW. Umm... The victory music got cutoff there. So, we have two cases of "long song, short scene" now (the first being Megalovania).
Huh, how did I get two 1-ups in a row there? I thought it just alternated between 8000 points and 1-up regularly. That was odd.
Uh, oh. The upper wall springboard here is giving me issues. Due to its proximity to the top of the screen, I'll often fall through it without landing on it.
NOTE: I did search the "ML" house, but didn't find anything new, so I didn't bother keeping any of that footage.
CP #2 is on the right side of this platform.
But... 4 1-ups is still a good score when I'm not looking at the screen.
Whoa, what? How did I fry that guy from that position? Well, at least that didn't happen while I was over the spikes. Okay, so let's look around a bit here...
Oh, I can't Start+Select out of here. Well, whatever. To be continued... Yo!
Anyway, let's try another "blind" bonus game.
Okay, now which platforms was it again? I kinda forgot the order that Mark told me...
Also, Mark informed me of a checkpoint 1-up in the shop area of Walkla Town, and it has to do with jumping on platforms in the correct order or something.
Umm... But, how do I get back with the P-switch? (Also, I don't feel like trying to double-grab here right now.)
So, let's just quickly go over 1Snake Pokey Desert.
AWW!!! If only I had maintained perfect rhythm all the way to the end...
Ah, and I bet this P-switch would reveal a ? block in that hole that would prevent the springboard from falling so that I can grab it.
Now, let's see if this is a reset pipe...
But... I have the power of slopes on my side here!
And, I guess I'll recollect the checkpoint 1-up and moon while I'm here.
...Wait, I'm a silly dummy! I need the springboard to reach the key in the first place!
Push!
There's also Snifits, along with the P-switch that I need.
Bonus game average: 12 / 4 = 3 1-ups each.
What the...? That one went way up off the top of the screen at first after I stomped it! That was weird!
BGM: Metroid Fusion - Tension Before a Confrontation
Okay, let's get outta here before my luck runs out!
Yeek!
Oh, and I guess I'll go on a proper star rampage here.
I'm pretty sure the Shy Guys are flammable and inflammable, so I'd better be careful while I'm trying to shoot fireballs in time with the music here.
Alright, that'll do it for now. But, I'm gonna ask Mark D about that checkpoint 1-up in Walkla Town...
Anyway, looks like I'll need to track down another key.
Heh. Pokey went down the hole.
I wonder if the snake itself is an oddball when it comes to star combos, since it gave me 400 points back when the star was nerfed to usually only give 200 per kill.
Killer combo! (14 hits, 40,400 points + 4 lives)
This little divot that used to have a P-switch block now just has 6 coins.
Whoa, hello! Well, I guess I found the "secret pipe"! (I didn't see a pipe, though...)
Whoa! Close call there.
Yep, there's a P-switch ? block there, exactly as I thought. So, I think I've got this puzzle solved. I'm just gonna have to watch out for the Phantos after I get the key.
The ice blocks are probably the intended way of opening this P-switch block, for players that don't happen to have a cape.
WAH! Oh, no! Not them!
Yep, and it's a cannon that launches me perfectly to the other side. (I didn't hold A or B, or any other buttons while I was flying through the air there.)
Really, you're giving me the silver P-switch right away now? Won't that make it easier for me to get an awesome extra life combo here?
Umm... Maybe not. It's most likely the platforms in the hidden area to the right of the Super Mushroom purchase.
Well, there's the key. So, that should mean it's no longer next to the keyhole in the next room.
Yep, there's P-switch ? blocks, as I suspected. Alright, now let's see what's beyond that wall to the left...
Maybe the slopes were affecting their aim on me, but now I'm probably a sitting duck in the water/chocolate here...
I'm honestly not sure which platforms the 1-up checkpoints are on... Oh, I just thought of something... Did Mark change anything involving going over the ceiling here?
Whoa, that was close!
Aw, that's it for the Megalovania music and the flashy colors?
BGM: CUSTOM - The Afterwarders, by HarvettFox96
And, CP #4 is overlapping the Toad on the left side of this pipe. (Huh, I didn't know that the 1-up checkpoints you touched were preserved if you went through a pipe or door.)
BGM: Super Mario Advance 4: SMB3 - Slot Minigame Win
But, aren't those 1-up checkpoints in kind of obscure locations? I mean, I don't think anyone would ever find them without at least a hint of some sort.
Oh, there's the blue P-switch. I did indeed just happen to miss it. Okay, fair enough.
BGM: Super Mario Bros. 2 - Indoors (All-Stars version)
Heh. There was one last silver coin. If I hadn't dilly-dallied up above, I certainly could've gotten a much greater combo.
Good enough.
Okay, I've reset this room by going through that door twice. Now, let's go back to where I found that "secret pipe"...
Maybe it's on this platform here?
And now to do some Phanto dodging...
Aw, nuts! I didn't make it back to the springboard in time... Welp, gotta use the reset pipe again.
I just have to stay filled with determination!
And, I see the key over there, which I'll need the springboard for.
Whoa, made it! Hoo, boy! If I had mistimed that up button press there, I would've had a bad time.
Okay, I've collected the hidden coin block, and I'll just leave the springboard there while I go get the key...
Of course, the teleport blocks below the screen there took me to the "secret pipe" area earlier anyway, since the entire screen was set to that exit.
Hello, and welcome back to Super Mario Babys! So, Mark D informed me about a secret pipe that I had missed in Walkla Town, so let's go look for it.
I bet this area has been changed.
Oh, there have been changes down here too.
Alright, so we got these Shy Guys that I gotta ride across spikes. This is quite similar to the top of the second tower in 4-3 of SMB2 (so the SMB2 music here is fitting).
Ooh, I'll certainly take a free cape! ...Oh, wait, I think I won here!
The first 1-up checkpoint is on the right side of this lower-right platform here.
GERONIMO!!!
Also, that mushroom is now jammed.
Goal tape average: 440 / 12 = 36.667 stars each.
Also, these evil homing bullets seem a little wonky, and don't seem to have the best aim...
Nothing much I can do up here. Can I enter that pipe below?
Also, moon again, since I hadn't recollected this one with Luigi yet. Oh, and I was ducking a lot there in case the secret pipe was hidden in those cement blocks.
CP #3 is on the right side of this platform.
Alright, let's see if this room is any different.
Maybe ? blocks will appear over the chocolate pit when I hit the P-switch?
The reset pipe also had the added benefit of getting the Phantos off my tail for the time being.
Okay, I'll just leave the key on the ground there while I transport the springboard to where I'll need it.
Whoa, I wasn't expecting another Phanto to come at me from down there!
I'm guessing there are teleport tiles behind that brown block wall, which I'll obviously need a P-switch to reach.
...Well! Turns out I did something in an unintended way! Now, first of all, let me point out how to get the checkpoint 1-up.
Oh, what's this? There's now some stuff here, including the actual pipe that I was supposed to go through.
Umm... Did I miss a blue P-switch somewhere?
Push!
I wonder why you didn't use a diagonal pipe for that cannon, though... Anyway, there's a reset door and a springboard here.
Oof! Alright, it's all up to me and my cape now!
Uh, oh... I feel like I'm going to have a bad time.
That block next to the exit pipe there is new.
Yeah, it's probably a reset pipe, in case I screw up this puzzle here. So, there's ice blocks, and a springboard that immediately falls down the hole...
Push!
AHH!!! Phantos! (BTW, the flashing colors here are neat.)
